description: Least positive multiple of n that when written in base 10 uses only 0's and 1's.
comments: It is easy to show that a(n) always exists and in fact has at most n digits [Wu, 2014]. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jun 13 2014a(n) = min{A007088(k): k > 0 and A007088(k) mod n = 0}. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 10 2012

formula: a(n) = n*A079339(n) for n > 0. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Jun 15 2014
